it shouldnt matter what data i put in, i have variables as my data so it wouldnt make sense to post it here. 
and its not interval as you suggested, ive tried so many things to no avail. that is why i might think its a bug as its only present when those 2 options are put in.

Yest, I'm suggesting *make it hide duplicates by default whenever a `time` axis is used*.
@100pah Could you give some advice on how to do so?

Hi! We've received your issue and please be patient to get responded. ğŸ‰
The average response time is expected to be within one day for weekdays.

In the meanwhile, please make sure that **you have posted enough image to demo your request**. You may also check out the [API](http://echarts.apache.org/api.html) and [chart option](http://echarts.apache.org/option.html) to get the answer.

Have a nice day! ğŸµ

I think the API has changed since then, I tried this myself and tree charts seem to work fine, but I think the option you're looking for is the `curveness` inside the `lineStyle` option: https://ecomfe.github.io/echarts-doc/public/en/option.html#series-tree.lineStyle.curveness

Here's a working codepen for version 4.1.0:
https://codepen.io/jivanvl/pen/ZPpypZ

Currently pie doesn't support label rotation.
That's what `stack` do.
@100pah Please have a look at this problem.
I think `finished` can be used in your situation. Can you describe your issue with more information?

In version 4.1.0  I had to set [triggerEvent](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#xAxis.triggerEvent) = true
Occasionally +1

Thanks for these workarounds, I'm having the same issue. It would be awesome if the following was possible: 
- 2 or more series of type map (showing on the same map)
- Each series with its own visualMap, so that each series can be mapped to different colors, and controlled independently
- All of the series visible at the same time (if they overlap, for example US appears in more than one series, I don't even expect colors to mix, the one added latest can take precedence. As long as all those that don't overlap show at the same time). 

I doubt I'll have time to do this myself, but if I manage to I'll make a pull request and comment it here.
